meanings.definition: Past tense of behold: to see or observe
meanings.sent1: Yesterday, I beheld a beautiful sunset.
meanings.sent2: She beheld the stars twinkling in the night sky.
meanings.sent3: The cat beheld the laser pointer with curiosity.
meanings.sent4: His eyes beheld the vast ocean stretching out before him.
meanings.sent5: The child beheld the magic trick with wonder and amazement.

meanings.definition: Past participle of behold: seen or observed
meanings.sent1: The beheld painting was truly breathtaking.
meanings.sent2: The beheld landscape left everyone speechless.
meanings.sent3: The beheld treasure was finally discovered in the attic.
meanings.sent4: Her beheld expression showed pure astonishment.
meanings.sent5: The beheld phenomenon puzzled the scientists for days.
